p: Food loss occurs throughout the supply chain in the pre-wholesaler stage. Waste, in contrast, occurs in a subsequent stage and is related to the consumerâ€™s behavior [ 42]. Data reported in the ENAPREF survey represent the average per capita acquisition of food products in Peruvian households [ 36]. Therefore, these data do not represent the actual consumption of food, but the quantity that is purchased, not accounting for food waste in the household. Food loss was, therefore, accounted for in the assessment by following the regional estimations in the FAO report on food losses and waste [ 42]. Average losses for Latin America were extracted from this report as shown in Table 4.
